intro: Ferraria macrochlamys subsp. kamiesbergensis, commonly known as the Kamiesberg ferraria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland or woodland habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months of the year. It is a perennial herb that is well adapted to the arid conditions of its native region.
